title: Zoe Ball pulls out of Strictly It Takes Two again tonight as 'nasty' flu battle rages on
text:

Zoe Ball has been forced to pull out of Strictly - It Takes Two for the third night running.

The poorly presenter has been suffering from a "nasty bout of flu" and is too unwell to appear on the show.

Instead, Gethin Jones will once again step in to present the show alongside Rylan Clark-Neal -and they will be joined by Anneka & Kevin and Karim & Amy, as both couples prepare for Saturday night’s live Strictly Come Dancing show.

Gethin was a popular replacement for Zoe, with viewers tweeting their appreciation for the substitute.

One said: "I said it last year when @GethincJones filled in for @ZoeTheBall on #ItTakesTwo that he's great and @bbcstrictly needs to use him more. Gethin is such a big part of #Strictly he could share it with Zoe"

"Much as I like Rylan, I always thought Gethin would be a better fit for #ItTakesTwo as he’s just proved," added another.

A third said: "Finally a decent replacement for @ZoeTheBall on #ItTakesTwo @GethincJones doing an amazing job presenting tonight, get better soon Zoe but Gethin is a great replacement"

Zoe has also missed her Radio 2 Breakfast slot yesterday, which was instead presented by Nicki Chapman.

(Image: BBC)

She tweeted: "Gutted to say I've been taken down by a nasty bout of flu. Huge apologies for missing the R2 Breakfast Show & It Takes Two.

"Thanks to @Nicki_Chapman & @GethincJones for stepping in. Promise to be back ASAP. Sending love to anyone else illin with this flu, it’s such a stinker."

The BBC has also confirmed This week’s It Takes Two Friday panel will also be live in the studio, as Strictly super fans Amber Gill, Gaby Roslin, and Rufus Hound discuss the glittering highs and lows of the series so far.

It Takes Two will be shown on BBC One at 5.15pm for the last time today (due to the World Athletics Championships), before returning to its home on BBC Two at 6.30pm from Monday 7 October.
description: Zoe Ball is still too unwell to present Strictly - It Takes Two tonight, with Gethin Jones forced to step in again to cover for her
